The 'last_' family of functions

Source: vignettes/last_family.Rmd
last_family.Rmd

This vignette is about the functions with the prefix ‘last_’.

Fetching the API

Retrieve market summary insights.

library(financr)

datas <- last_market_summary(region = "US")

str(datas)
#> 'data.frame':    16 obs. of  38 variables:
#>  $ fullexchangename              : chr  "CME" "CBOT" "CME" "CME" ...
#>  $ symbol                        : chr  "ES=F" "YM=F" "NQ=F" "RTY=F" ...
#>  $ gmtoffsetmilliseconds         : int  -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 3600000 -18000000 -18000000 ...
#>  $ headsymbolasstring            : chr  "ES=F" "YM=F" "NQ=F" "RTY=F" ...
#>  $ language                      : chr  "en-US" "en-US" "en-US" "en-US" ...
#>  $ regularmarkettime_raw         : POSIXct, format: "2025-10-03 12:59:04" "2025-10-03 12:59:01" ...
#>  $ regularmarkettime_fmt         : chr  "8:59AM EDT" "8:59AM EDT" "8:59AM EDT" "8:59AM EDT" ...
#>  $ regularmarketchangepercent_raw: num  0.0554 0.1111 0.0418 0.3516 0.6283 ...
#>  $ regularmarketchangepercent_fmt: num  0.06 0.11 0.04 0.35 0.63 0.79 3.09 0.15 0.1 -0.6 ...
#>  $ headsymbol                    : logi  TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ...
#>  $ quotetype                     : chr  "FUTURE" "FUTURE" "FUTURE" "FUTURE" ...
#>  $ typedisp                      : chr  "Futures" "Futures" "Futures" "Futures" ...
#>  $ tradeable                     : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ contractsymbol                : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ regularmarketpreviousclose_raw: num  6766.8 46806 25110 2474.1 60.5 ...
#>  $ regularmarketpreviousclose_fmt: num  6766.8 46806 25110 2474.1 60.5 ...
#>  $ exchangetimezonename          : chr  "America/New_York" "America/New_York" "America/New_York" "America/New_York" ...
#>  $ regularmarketchange_raw       : num  3.75 52 10.5 8.7 0.38 ...
#>  $ regularmarketchange_fmt       : num  3.75 52 10.5 8.7 0.38 30.4 1.43 0.0018 0.004 -0.1 ...
#>  $ cryptotradeable               : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ exchangedatadelayedby         : int  10 10 10 10 10 10 10 0 0 0 ...
#>  $ firsttradedatemilliseconds    : num  9.69e+11 1.02e+12 9.69e+11 1.50e+12 9.67e+11 ...
#>  $ exchangetimezoneshortname     : chr  "EDT" "EDT" "EDT" "EDT" ...
#>  $ hasprepostmarketdata          : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ regularmarketprice_raw        : num  6770.5 46858 25120.5 2482.8 60.9 ...
#>  $ regularmarketprice_fmt        : num  6770.5 46858 25120.5 2482.8 60.9 ...
#>  $ marketstate                   : chr  "REGULAR" "REGULAR" "REGULAR" "REGULAR" ...
#>  $ custompricealertconfidence    : chr  "NONE" "NONE" "NONE" "NONE" ...
#>  $ market                        : chr  "us24_market" "us24_market" "us24_market" "us24_market" ...
#>  $ quotesourcename               : chr  "Delayed Quote" "Delayed Quote" "Delayed Quote" "Delayed Quote" ...
#>  $ exchange                      : chr  "CME" "CBT" "CME" "CME" ...
#>  $ sourceinterval                : int  10 10 10 10 30 15 15 15 15 15 ...
#>  $ shortname                     : chr  "S&P Futures" "Dow Futures" "Nasdaq Futures" "Russell 2000 Futures" ...
#>  $ region                        : chr  "US" "US" "US" "US" ...
#>  $ triggerable                   : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ currency                      : chr  NA NA NA NA ...
#>  $ pricehint                     : int  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA 4 4 2 ...
#>  $ longname                      : chr  NA NA NA NA ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 3
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr [1:3] NA "USD" "JPY"
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"

Or retrieve currencies and their latest ‘USD’ values, e.g. currencies with a 3-letters ISO code that begin with ‘Z’.


changes_z <- last_currencies(keep = "^Z", get_changes = T)

str(changes_z)
#> 'data.frame':    2 obs. of  20 variables:
#>  $ symbol              : chr  "ZAR" "ZMW"
#>  $ shortname           : chr  "ZAR" "ZMW"
#>  $ longname            : chr  "South African Rand" "ZMW"
#>  $ locallongname       : chr  "South African Rand" "ZMW"
#>  $ currency            : chr  "USD" "USD"
#>  $ exchangename        : chr  "CCY" "CCY"
#>  $ instrumenttype      : chr  "CURRENCY" "CURRENCY"
#>  $ firsttradedate      : POSIXct, format: "2003-12-01" "2013-01-03"
#>  $ gmtoffset           : int  3600 3600
#>  $ timezone            : chr  "BST" "BST"
#>  $ exchangetimezonename: chr  "Europe/London" "Europe/London"
#>  $ regularmarketprice  : num  0.058 0.0421
#>  $ regularmarketdayhigh: num  0.0581 0.0423
#>  $ regularmarketdaylow : num  0.0577 0.0419
#>  $ fiftytwoweekhigh    : num  0.0673 0.0444
#>  $ fiftytwoweeklow     : num  0.0502 0.0345
#>  $ previousclose       : num  0.0578 0.0422
#>  $ regular_timezone    : chr  "BST" "BST"
#>  $ to                  : chr  "USD" "USD"
#>  $ timestamp           : POSIXct, format: "2025-10-03 13:09:04" "2025-10-03 13:06:36"
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 1
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr "USD"
#>  - attr(*, "exchange")= chr " => USD"
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"
#>  - attr(*, "date.begin")= POSIXct[1:1], format: "2025-10-03 13:06:36"
#>  - attr(*, "date.end")= POSIXct[1:1], format: "2025-10-03 13:09:04"
#>  - attr(*, "date.dif")= num 2.47

Scraping on Yahoo Finance

Some functions rely on web scraping (Yahoo Finance webpages), such as last_indices() and last_crypto() which respectively provide the latest financial values (in USD) for over 40 global market indices and 100 cryptocurrencies.

last_indices() return a data.frame with the latest financial value of major world financial indices.

indices <- last_indices()
str(indices)
#> 'data.frame':    41 obs. of  11 variables:
#>  $ symbol        : chr  "^GSPC" "^DJI" "^IXIC" "^NYA" ...
#>  $ name          : chr  "S&P 500" "Dow Jones Industrial Average" "NASDAQ Composite" "NYSE Composite Index" ...
#>  $ price         : num  6715 46520 22844 21608 6909 ...
#>  $ change        : num  4.15 78.62 88.89 -32.03 -68.85 ...
#>  $ change_percent: num  0.06 0.17 0.39 -0.15 -0.99 0.44 0.66 -0.48 0.5 -0.26 ...
#>  $ volume        : num  3.03e+09 4.43e+08 8.56e+09 0.00 0.00 ...
#>  $ day_range1    : num  6693 46284 22730 0 0 ...
#>  $ day_range2    : num  6732 46589 22901 0 0 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range1 : num  4835 36612 14784 0 0 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range2 : num  6732 46714 22901 21696 7145 ...
#>  $ currency      : chr  "USD" "USD" "USD" "USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 1
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr "USD"
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"

last_crypto() return a data.frame of 100 crypto-currencies values in USD ($).

krypt <- last_crypto()
str(krypt)
#> 'data.frame':    100 obs. of  15 variables:
#>  $ symbol                          : chr  "BTC-USD" "ETH-USD" "XRP-USD" "USDT-USD" ...
#>  $ name                            : chr  "Bitcoin USD" "Ethereum USD" "XRP USD" "Tether USDt USD" ...
#>  $ price                           : num  1.20e+05 4.47e+03 3.02 1.00 1.10e+03 ...
#>  $ change                          : num  993.55 56.96 0.0334 0.0004 45.48 ...
#>  $ change_percent                  : num  0.83 1.29 1.12 0.04 4.3 1.01 0.01 -0.76 1.56 0.31 ...
#>  $ market_cap                      : num  2.40e+12 5.39e+11 1.81e+11 1.76e+11 1.54e+11 ...
#>  $ volume                          : num  7.18e+10 4.66e+10 7.55e+09 1.66e+11 4.45e+09 ...
#>  $ volume_in_currency_24hr         : num  7.18e+10 4.66e+10 7.55e+09 1.66e+11 4.45e+09 ...
#>  $ total_volume_all_currencies_24hr: num  7.18e+10 4.66e+10 7.55e+09 1.66e+11 4.45e+09 ...
#>  $ circulating_supply              : num  1.99e+07 1.21e+08 5.99e+10 1.76e+11 1.39e+08 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_change_percent           : num  94.44 85.85 468.8 0.06 96.38 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range1                   : num  58895.21 1386.8 0.49 1 509.84 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range2                   : num  1.24e+05 4.95e+03 3.65 1.00 1.11e+03 ...
#>  $ from                            : chr  "BTC" "ETH" "XRP" "USDT" ...
#>  $ to                              : chr  "USD" "USD" "USD" "USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 101
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr [1:101] "BTC" "ETH" "XRP" "USDT" ...
#>  - attr(*, "exchange")= chr [1:100] "BTC => USD" "ETH => USD" "XRP => USD" "USDT => USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi TRUE
